pages.transcription:
Presented to 
Edward A. Barnes
on his Birth-day
by his sister Della
10 years of age

Saturday, January 1, 1870.
Pleasant. Mother quite unwell. Had a New Year's pie. Lillie spent the evening with one of her young friends.

Monday 3
Cold. Recieved a call Mr Williams. Pastor of the Tabernacle Church.

Friday, January 7, 1870
Saturday 8
Very Cold. Della took two poems for me down to the Office of the "Bright Side."
Mr Alden sent a me a paper.
Sunday 9

Thursday, January 13, 1870

Friday 14
Received the "Song Messenger of the North-west"
Della sick with tooth-acke.
Saturday 15
Lillie went to the Museum
She was the drama of "Little Emily."

Sunday, January 16, 1870.
Monday 17
Very cold. Father came home at noon quite unwell. Think it was the roast pork we had for dinner yesterday.
Tuesday 18

Wednesday, January 19, 1870

Thursday 20

Friday 21
Finished "The Gates Afar" - A splendid book full of strange, but beautiful, ideas about Heaven

Saturday, January 22, 1870.
Mild & pleasant.
Mother finished the shirt that she began for me yesterday.

Sunday 23
Lent "Faith Gartney's Girlhood" to Mrs. Winter
Lillie brought a good book from the Sabbath School.

Monday 24
Cloudy. Della gave me this diary for a birthday gift. 
Death of Miss Mexican across the way

Tuesday, January 25, 1870
Mild & pleasent.
Wrote a poem
recieved the Feb. No of "our Young Folks"

Wednesday 26
A snow storm

Nothing more of note


Thursday 27
Rather cold.
Recieved unclear "Bright Side"

Friday, January 28, 1870
Mild, but cloudy
Wrote a little. 
Lillie passed examinations. She is now in the 4th grade.

Saturday 29
A dull cloudy day.
Looks very much like a storm
Did not write any.

Sunday 30
A stormy Sabbath

Finished the "Book of Esther" & the "Book of Mark"

Father had company.

Monday, January 31, 1870.
Stormy in the morning.
An all-day prayer meeting held at Farwell Hall. Hope it was well attended.

Mother finished Mrs B's wraper


Tuesday, February 1
Warmer.
Commenced copying My Story
One more winter month,

Wednesday 2
Cold. but pleasant
Wrote on My Story.
Miss Olive Logan Lectures at Farwell Hall

Thursday, February 3, 1870.
Still pleasant, but cloudy, with occasional gleams of sunlight.
Wrote on my story
Nothing more of note.
Friday 4
Mild & pleasant. Wrote a little. F.B. Gough lectrues at Farwell Hall this evening on "Temprence"
Wouldn't I like to hear him.
Mother unwell. She had a call.
Saturday 5
A beautiful day.
Recieved the "Song Messenger"
My Story almost copied.

Sunday, February 6, 1870
A beautiful Sabbath - clear sky & pleasant air.
Della brought home two new books from the S. S. Library.

Monday 7
Still very pleasant.

Read "The Highland Pastor" Much interested in it.

Next Monday is St. Valentine's Day.
Tuesday 8
Pleasent but cloudy.
Finished copying my story. Read two good sermons in yesterdays Times.

Wednesday, February 9, 1870
Pleasant but rather cold.
Copied a poem
Mother has a bud & a sweet rose on her monthly rose-bush.

Thursday 10
Pleasant. Sent by Della a poem & a story to the "Bright Side" Mr Alden sent me good news - my two other poems accepted. Della did my business for one nicely

Friday 11
Mild & pleasant.
Wrote 2 Valentines.
Uncle Augustus call in on father at the shop.

Saturday, February 12, 1870
Clear & pleasant. but exceedingly cold.

A day of anxiety for us all.

Father went out to the stock yards.

Sunday 13
Cloudy but warmer
Lillie had a swollen face. Had 2 good books from the Sunday School

Monday 14
Valentine's Day. Very pleasant.
Wrote a letter for papa.
Lillie recieved 2 valentines.
Della, I -

Tuesday, February 15, 1870
Still pleasant but rather chilly.
Mother had a call
Father brought home four pictorial papers
Wednesday 16
Mild & pleasant.
Mother  took a walk over to Mrs Barnard's
She saw Mr Williams.
Thursday 17
Dark & Cloudy with flurries of snow.
Cold towards night.
Next Tuesday is Washington's Birthday.

Friday, February 18, 1870
A cold morning, but a pleasant day.
Mother had a call.
Father recieved a letter from uncle Augustus.

Saturday 19
Very cold & a terrible snow storm. Finished Book of Job.
Mother went out on business for father. Della went down to the city with Georgie Winter.

Sunday 20
A very cold Sabbath.
The Sabbath is the golden clasp which binds together the volume of the week.
Longfellow

Monday, February 21, 1870
A bitter cold morning.
Milder towards night.
Nothing more of note.

Tuesday 22
Pleasant & much warmer
Washington's Birthday.
No school for the girls. Lillie went down to the city.
She saw the Fenians.

Wednesday 23
A mild pleasant day.
The Winter months have almost gone - Monday being the last day.
I long for Spring time.

Thursday, February 24, 1870
Another fine day. Wrote a letter for father. Have had my diary a month. What a comfort it is.
Della stayed at home to help Mother wash.

Friday 25
Mild & pleasant.

We had a call from Nellie Clark. Her visit was a great surprise to us all. Mother obtained her Machine needle that she has wanted so much,


Saturday 26
Dark & Cloudy
Rainy afternoon
Papa had a call this evening. But he was not at home.

Sunday, February 27, 1870.
A wet, stormy Sabbath.
rain & snow together.
Finished the Book of St Luke this evening.
The girls didn't go to Sunday School.

Monday 28
Still stormy. The last day of Winter.
Della still ailing from her sudden illness last night.
Father went out to the stock yds.

Tuesday, March 1
Clear & pleasant. Finished the "Young Man's Counselor" by Daniel Wise.
a very interesting book.
"Tis Spring once more, 
For Winter is over"

Wednesday, March 2, 1870.
A Pleasant day. Mother had a call. Much interested
in a book by Mrs Henry Wood.
Mother went to bed with a severe head-ache.
Thursday 3
Cold & Cloudy. Snow storm in the evening. 
Millie & Matie Reed started for the East.

Friday 4
Still Cloudy.
Recieved the March No. Of "Our Young Folks"
Lillie brought her a pair of Bracelets

Saturday, March 5, 1870.
Not very pleasant & rather cold.
Mrs Reed gave me her photograph
Mother & the girls had a busy day.

Sunday 6
Another stormy Sabbath & very good sleighing.
Finished the Proverbs of Solomon.
Della recieved her "Everybody's Paper"

Monday 7
mild but stormy
recieved the "Bright Side"
It did not contain anything of mine which made me feel somewhat disapppointed

.
Tuesday, March 8, 1870.
Clear & pleasant but rather cold.
Commenced a short prose piece.
Another sweet rose in full blossom on Mothers rose bush
Wednesday 9
A beautiful Spring day - clear & mild. 
Wrote upon my piece. My Psalm today was the 119th which is so long & so
replete with devotional precepts.
Thursday 10
Cold & cloudy

Did not feel as well as usual.

Nothing more to record.

Friday, March 11, 1870.
A snow storm cold & blustering,
Mrs Reed sent me a book "January & June" by B.F. Taylor. It's a splendid book. 
Finished to Book of the Ecclisiastes
Saturday 12
Cold. Bleak & very stormy
Finished my prose piece.
The girls went down to the city on business for father
A wild storm & a wild night.

Sunday 13
A bleak morning but a pleasant day. 
A heavy fall of snow last night.
Splendid sleighing & which is improved, too, by
those who can enjoy it.

Monday, March 14, 1870
Mild & pleasant
Mother had a call
Father brought home a tract entitled
"The Christian Traveler"
Tuesday 15
Another terrible snow storm, with high winds & drifting snow.
The girls had but one session at school. 
Finished the Songs of Soloman
Wednesday 16
Cold & pleasant
Mother had a call
Grand sleighing carnival took place on Michigan Ave.

Thursday, March 17, 1870
Pleasant & much warmer.
The sleighing going off fast.
Nothing more of note

Friday 18
A beautiful day. 
Mother had company to dinner. Recieved  my "Song Messenger"
for March

Saturday 19
Cold & cloudy with fitful gleams of sunshine
Rain at night
Felt bad and discouraged all day.

Sunday, March 20, 1870
A dark unpleasant Sabbath with a cold March wind.
Mother had a call. Finished the Book of St. John.
Della recieved her "Everybody's Paper"
Monday 21
A nice day - mild & pleasant.
Began Hathorne's "Tanglewood Tales"
Nothing more of note

Tuesday 22
Changable weather  - now strormy & now pleasant.
Mother had a call in the evening.
The girls wrote to Nellie  & Matie Reed

Wednesday, March 23, 1870.
A beautiful day - mild, bright & Spring-like.
Wrote a letter & a short hymn. 
Mother busily at work on Lillie's new dress.
Thursday 24
Another beautiful day.
Seems so much like Spring that I long to get out once more

Friday 25
Still very clear, mild & pleasant. Quite confortable without a fire.
Rain at night
Della collecting agates

Saturday, March 26, 1870.
A rainy day. Leaden skies & wet streets.
I am to have a piece out in the "Bright Side" Monday.
Lillie had a new pair of shoes.
Sunday 27
cold & cloudy.
Rained a little.
Father & Lillie went to the Stock Yards

Monday 28
Cloudy. Not very pleasant. 
Recieved the 'Bright Side' containing one of my poems.
One Answer

Tuesday, March 29, 1870
A beautiful morning, but rather cold & cloudy towards night.
Father brought home another copy of the "Bright Side"

Wednesday 30
A rainy day.
Cold, dark & dreary
Can think of nothing more worthy of note
Thursday 31
Another dark & rainy day. Finished the "Book of Psalms" for the 5th time by course.
Recieved the "Song Messenger" for April. a double number
Mother quite unwell all day.

Friday, April 1, 1870
Cold, Cloudy & somewhat rainy. All Fools Day.
Wrote a letter. Mother better.
Della has 25 handsome marbles in her collection.
Saturday 2
A cloudy morning but a pleasant day.
Finished "Isa Greame's World"
A beautiful book
Sunday 3
A beautiful Sabbath
Wrote a letter for father.
The girls went out to the Stock Yards
Had 2 home papers

Monday, April 4, 1870
Another beautiful day - with a clear blue sky.
Della quite unwell all day
Received the April No of "Our Young Folks"

Tuesday 5
Still very pleasant & clear.
Lillie went down to the city on business for father.
Della still ailing

Wednesday 6
Still very clear & pleasant.
Wrote a letter. Della had a gift of little bracelet

Thursday, April 7, 1870.
Clear & very pleasant.
Had a head cold which made me almost sick

Friday 8
Another beautiful day. Mild, clear & pleasant
Felt better than I did yesterday

Saturday 9
Clear & pleasant.
This has been a week of nice weather.
Received a call from Rev. E. F. Williams.

Sunday, April 10, 1870.
A beautiful Sabbath.

Did not feel very well all day.

A sudden death of Scarlet fever quite near us,

Monday 11
Clear & pleasant & very dry.
Wrote a letter
Threatened with a fever but Mother broke it out
God Bless her!
Had a sick night

Tuesday 12
Pleasant, but somewhat cloudy
Felt better
The girls went to the sociable in the evening.

Wednesday, April 13, 1870
Pleasant, dry & very warm
Mother not very well

Thursday 14
Pleasent but cloudy
Mother had a call
Commenced a short story for the Bright Side

Friday 15
A rainy day & rather cold.
Wrote on my story
nothing more

Saturday, April 16, 1870
More snow.
A stormy morning, but a pleasant day. Finished my story
Della had company in the afternoon

Sunday 17
A beautiful Sabbath  - clear & mild.
Mother sick
Oh! that she was well

Monday 18
Pleasant but cloudy. Began copying my Story
Wrote a poem. Lillie went to the Stockyds
Della has 50 agates

Tuesday, April 19, 1870.
A pleasant morning but a rainy afternoon
Wrote on my story
Mother had a new calico wraper

Wednesday 20
A rainy day
Wrote on my story
Mother had a call
Recieved a letter from Cousin Erm

Thursday 21
A pleasent day
Wrote a little

Friday, April 22, 1870
Pleasant clear & rather warm
My story nearly copied
Mother unwell

Saturday 23
Another warm, pleasant day.
Finished "The Arts"
Mother had a call

Sunday 24
A beautiful Sabbath, clear & warm but cold & rainy at night
Did not feel well
"A week from today is the First of May"

Monday, April 25, 1870.
Pleasant.
Finished copying my story
The girls at home for two weeks vacation

Tuesday 26
Pleasant
Wrote a letter
Lillie went up to the park

Wednesday 27
Pleasant but a thunderstorm at night
Wrote a poem
Mother & Della went out House Runting

Thursday, April 28, 1870.
Pleasant
Copied my poem.
Lillie unwell. 
Della went to a Church Sociable in the evening with Mrs Winter

Friday 29
Pleasant
Wrote a little
Nothing more worthy of note

Saturday 30
Pleasant
A lady sent me a book to read.
One more Spring month

Sunday, May 1, 1870
A beautiful Sabbath for the first of May
Mother sent a dish of pot pie to a poor woman

Monday 2
Pleasant
Recieved 'Our Young Folks'

Tuesday 3
Pleasant & warm
Recieved the Bright Side & Song Messenger
Papa hurt his thumb badly

Wednesday, May 4, 1870.
A warm morning. Had a nice shower. Wrote a letter

Thursday 5
Stil pleasant
A rainy night with thunder & vivid lightning.
Mrs Winter sent me the "Waverly Magazine"

Friday 6
Cloudy & rather cold
Mother had company
wrote a short poem

Saturday, May 7, 1870
Cold & cloudy. Wrote a letter & copied a poem.
Mother had a sick day. Father bought him a suit of clothes

Sunday 8
A pleasant Sabbath.
Had a call from Mrs Lane.
Finished the book of Romans. Lillie brought home "Everybody's Paper"

Monday 9
Cloudy
Wrote a letter
Finished the Book of Jeremiah

Tuesday, May 10, 1870.
A day of sunshine, clouds & showers. Della had a new pair of shoes. She & Lillie went to the singing school in the evening

Wednesday 11
Pleasant
Finished the "Lamentations of Jeremiah"

Thursday 12
Clear & pleasant
Went to bed with a hard head-ache
Mother not very well

Friday May 13 1870
Warm & pleasant
Read a beautiful story.
Mother had company

Saturday 14
A warm day

Sunday 15
A beautiful Sabbath
Mothers birthday

Monday, May 16, 1870
Dry & very warm.
Father at home house hunting.
Della quite unwell

Tuesday 17
Still warm & pleasant
Father's Birthday

Wednesday 18
Still warm & pleasant

Thursday, May 19, 1870.
Warm & pleasant
Had a nice shower
Mother had company in the evening
Friday 20
warm & cloudy.
Mother went to Mrs Harwoods

Saturday 21
Still pleasant.
Wrote a letter for father.
Della had a new hat

Sunday, May 22, 1870
A warm Sabbath
Mother had company

Monday 23
Pleasant not withstanding two heavy showers.
Nothing more 

Tuesday 24
Pleasant.
The Queen's Birthday
Recieved a call. The girls attended a concert

Wednesday, May 25, 1870.
Still warm & pleasant
Wrote a note
Mother has a pritty bud on her rose bush

Thursday 26
Pleasant
Cool towards night. The girls went to the unclear

Friday 27
Pleasant but cool
Mother had company in the evening

Saturday, May 28, 1870
Very pleasant
Mr Harwood done me an act of kindness
Lillie gave me a knife
Sunday 29
A beautiful Sabbath
Had our first strawberry short-cake
Monday 30
Clear & pleasant
"Decoration Day"

Another act of kindness from Mr Winter

Tuesday, May 31, 1870
Pleasant but rather cloudy
Nothing more of note.
Last day of Spring
Wednesday, June 1
Pleasant - a gentleman gave me a box of strawberries
Recieved a package of cake from the festival.
Thursday 2
Pleasant

Friday, June 3, 1870
Clear & very warm
Finished the Book of Ezekiel
Nothing more

Saturday 4
Pleasant
Had a very heavy thunder-shower at noon
Recieved a letter

Sunday 5
A beautiful Sabbath
Had the pleasure of attending the dedication of the First Congregational Church.
A beautiful service.

Monday, June 6, 1870
Pleasant.
Recieved the "Song Messenger"
Found one of my poems copied in a Boston paper

Tuesday 7
Pleasant
Sent a story & 2 poems to the "Bright Side"

Wednesday 8
Rain
Sent a poem to the Waverly Magazine.
Lillie gave me a pencil.

Thursday, June 9, 1870
Cloudy
Finished the Book of Daniel
Mother had a call

Friday 10
Cloudy
Read the death of Charles Dickens. The great novelist has gone to his rest.

Saturday 11
Pleasant.
Mother bought herself a new runner

Sunday, June 12, 1870
A pleasant Sunday

Monday 13
Rainy
Moved. Our landlord lent me Shakespeare

Tuesday 14
Had a heavy shower

Wednesday, June 15, 1870.
Cloudy but pleasant.
Della passed examination. She is now in the 4th grade.

Thursday 16
Clear & warm
Finished Shakespeare's "Tempest" & the Book of Hosea.

Friday 17
Pleasant
Mother getting ready for the picnic tomorrow
Received a letter

Saturday, June 18, 1870
Very warm

Mother & the girls went to a picnic.

Wrote to Rout & Cady

Sunday 19
A very warm Sabbath. Papa had company

Monday 20
Very warm. Light shower.

Tuesday, June 21, 1870
Still warm
Recieved "Our Young Folks"

Wednesday 22
Hot & dry
An act of kindness from Mr Winter
Copied a poem

Thursday 23
Still warm
Wrote a letter

Friday, June 24, 1870
Very warm
A lady sent me a book to read.

Saturday 25
Very warm.
Recieved a letter.
Been a warm dry week

Sunday 26
Another warm Sunday.
A little sprinkle of rain.

Monday, June 27, 1870
Very warm
Week from today is the 4th of July

Tuesday 28
Warm
Heavy shower at noon. It was very welcome

Wednesday 29
Warm
Another shower

Thursday, June 30, 1870
Hottest day yet,
Mother had a call.
& father a present.
Heavy storm at night

Friday, July 1
Cool & Cloudy
Della had company

Saturday 2
Pleasant
Took a ride & voted.

Sunday, July 3, 1870.
A very warm Sabbath. Nothing more

Monday 4
Very warm.
"Independence Day"
Took dinner with Mrs Barton

Tuesday 5
Pleasant
Father unwell.
A lady sent me the "Story of the great March"

Wednesday, July 6, 1870
Unpleasant & rainy

Thursday 7
Showery
Looked over a lot of old books.

Friday 8
Pleasant

Saturday, July 9, 1870
Pleasant
Father came home sick at night

Sunday 10
Somewhat rainy
Della had a sick day
Finished the Old Testament.
Monday 11
Pleasant
Received the "Song Messenger"

Tuesday, July 12, 1870.
Very pleasant
Began the Old Testament.

Wednesday 13
Cloudy
A nice shower at night

Thursday 14
A rainy morning - but a nice day
A lady sent me some reading

Friday, July 15, 1870
Pleasant,
War declared in Europe

Saturday 16
Pleasant
Read the Proof of 1st Timothy
Sunday 17
A very warm Sunday

Monday, July 18, 1870
Very warm
Della had company

Tuesday 19
Still warm
Finished the Dead Letter. A good story

Wednesday 20
Dry & Warm

Thursday, July 21, 1870
Still dry & warm.
Father sick
The girls away all day

Friday 22
Warm
Nothing more

Saturday 23
Warm
This has been a hot dry week
Read 2nd Timothy

Sunday, July 24, 1870
A very warm Sabbath

Monday 25
Very warm
Had a splendid shower.
Finished The Psalms
Tuesday 26
Warm
wrote a letter

Wednesday, July 27, 1870
Warm
Della cut her foot badly

Thursday 28
Cool & cloudy
Father & mother both unwell

Friday 29
Pleasant.
The girls went to a picnic held at evernoon
Mother had company

Saturday, July 30, 1870
Warm
Mother cut my hair
Sunday 31
A warm Sabbath
Began the Book of Psalms

Monday, August 1
Warm
One more Summer month

Tuesday, August 2, 1870
Pleasant & cloudy
Mrs Winter sent another "Waverly"
It contains my poem - Love.
Wednesday 3
Pleasant

Thursday 4
Pleasant

Friday, August 5, 1870
Pleasant
Rainy at night

Saturday 6
Pleasant
Lillie went down to the city

Sunday 7
A rainy Sabbath

Monday, August 8, 1870
Cloudy
Sent two poems - "Think of me" & "Evening" to the "Waverly".

Tuesday 9
Still cloudy
nothing more

Wednesday 10
Pleasant
A lady sent me some magazines.

Thursday, August 11, 1870
Pleasant

Friday 12
Cloudy
Recieveed "Our Young Folks"
Mrs Winter sent me a tumbler of jelly

Saturday 13
Wet & rainy
wrote a poem

Sunday, August 14, 1870
A warm Sabbath.
President Grant is spending the Sabbath in the city.

Monday 15
Pleasant
Della had company

Tuesday 16
Pleasant.
Finished the Book of Hebrews.

Wednesday, August 17, 1870
Pleasant
A very high wind

Thursday 18
Sent a poem "wicked words" to Our Young Folks

Friday 19
Cool & cloudy

Saturday, August 20, 1870
Still cloudy
read the Book of Peter

Sunday 21
A beautiful Sabbath

Monday 22
Pleasant & rather warm
Della had company.
Finished the book of Exodus

Tuesday, August 23, 1870
Pleasant
Mother had two calls

Wednesday 24
Pleasant
A high wind.
Had a disappointment

Thursday 25
Cool & Cloudy

Friday, August 26, 1870
Pleasant

Saturday 27
Pleasant
Commenced the Book of Revelations

Sunday 28
A pleasant Sabbath.
Father had a sick day. Had a nice shower

Monday, August 29, 1870
Pleasant
Father still unwell
Tuesday 30
Pleasant, a high wind
Father worse. He had two docters

Wednesday 31
Warm. Father quite comfortable
Mother had a call

Thursday, September 1, 1870.
Cloudy.
Had a shower, went to Lincoln Park. Had a nice ride.
Father had a bad night

Friday 2
Rainy
Recieved the "Waverly" containing my poem "Think of Me"
Father no better

Saturday 3
Pleasant
Father very low
Oh that he was a Christian

Sunday, September 4, 1870
A Pleasant Sabbath - but the saddest I ever spent
Father very low

Monday 5
Warm
Father a little better at night
mother had a call

Tuesday 6
Pleasant
Think father is out of danger
recieved a letter

Wednesday, September 7, 1870
Pleasant
Father still very feeble.

Thursday 8
Pleasant
rainy at night
Father a little better

Friday 9
Cool & Cloudy
Father better

Saturday, September 10, 1870
Pleasant
Father not as well
received a letter

Sunday 11
A beautiful Sabbath
Father about the same
received a letter

Monday 12
Pleasant
Father had a bad day

Tuesday, September 13, 1870
Pleasant
Father quite comfortable
Sent a poem 'All things to Enjoy' to the 'Waverly'

Wednesday 14
Very Warm

Thursday 15
Still pleasant
Nice rain

Friday, September 16, 1870.
Pleasant
Father better
Mother & Lillie went down town

Saturday 17
Pleasant
Had a nice library book

Sunday 18
A lovely Sabbath
Father better. He went out for the first time in 3 weeks.

Monday, September 19, 1870.
Pleasant
Much interested in my book

Tuesday 20
Warm & pleasant
Father the same

Wednesday 21
Warm & clear
Recieved the "Waverly" containing my poem 'Evening'

Thursday, September 22, 1870
Still warm

Had four beautiful books sent me to read.

Father the same
Friday 23
Rather unpleasant.
Father took a ride. Came home tired out

Saturday 24
Rainy
Commenced Wilkie Collin's
"Man & Wife"

Sunday. September 25, 1870.
Rainy in the morning.
Began the Book of Numbers.
Lillie sick in the evening
Monday 28
Cloudy
Father took a walk & came home with a new coffee pot
Tuesday 27
Pleasent
Had our new cooking stove

Wednesday, September 28, 1870
Still cloudy
Della sick
Thursday 29
Cloudy
Della much better
after a bad night
Friday 30
Dark & rainy
Had our flour & groceries.

Saturday, October 1, 1870
Pleasant.
The girls had a new pair of shoes a pice.
Sunday 2
A cloudy Sabbath
Mother & Lillie went out to the Stock Yards
Monday 3
Pleasant
Recieved a visit from Uncle Augustus,
Della sick again

Tuesday, October 4, 1870
Pleasant.
Received a letter
Della better
Finished the Book of Psalms
Wednesday 5
Pleasant but rather cool
nothing more
Thursday 6
Pleasant
A lady sent me two more books.

Friday, October 7, 1870.
Pleasant
Beautiful Fall weather

Saturday 8
Pleasant
False alarm of fire in our neighborhood.
Sunday 9
A beautiful October Sabbath
Almost sick with a head cold

Monday, October 10, 1870.
Cloudy & somewhat rainy
Father & Mother sent down town.
Tuesday 11
Pleasant
nothing more
Wednesday 12
Cold & unpleasant
Began Collin's Moonstone

Thursday, October 13, 1870
Very pleasant
Began the Book of Deuteronomy
Friday 14
Pleasant
Mother had a call
Saturday 15
very pleasant
Girls went visiting

Sunday, October 16, 1870.
A cheerless Sabbath
rained all day
Monday 17
Still rainy.
Father went on the Jury
Tuesday 18
Pleasant
Recieved Our Young Folks Sept No.

Wednesday, October 19, 1870.
Cold & unpleasant
Somewhat rainy too.
Finished Collin's Moonstone.
Great work
Thursday 20
Cloudy
Began the "Vale of Headers"
Mother had a hard days work
Friday 21
Pleasant
Received the "Waverly" containing
my poem.
Willie as a Sailor

Saturday, October 22, 1870.
Cloudy, but pleasant
Della had company
She bruised her finger badly
Sunday 23
A beautiful October Sabbath
A warm high wind 
Finished the Book of Revealations
Monday 24
Still pleasant & warm.
Sent "The Weary Wanderer" to the "Waverly"
Began the Psalms

Tuesday, October 25, 1870.
Unpleasant

A rainy night

Copied a poem

Wednesday 26
Still cloudy
A wedding next door.
Thursday 27
Very pleasant
Mother had a call
Subscribed for the "Life Boat"

Friday, October 28, 1870.
Pleasant
Began the Book of Joshua
Had our clock.
Saturday 29
Still pleasant
Della had company
Sunday 30
A wet rainy Sabbath
Looks dreary enough out of doors
Cold at night

Monday, October 31, 1870.
Pleasant, but rather cold.
Father had two calls. Had quite a gift from him.
Tuesday, November 1
A beautiful day for the 1st of November.
Father went to work for G S Whitiker
Wednesday 2
Still pleasant but rather cloudy
Mother had a call

Thursday, November 3, 1870.
Pleasant but cold.
Mother had quite a lot of company.
Recieved "Our Young Folks" for Oct.
Friday 4
Cloudy
A rainy afternoon
Began the New Testiment
Saturday 5
Pleasant
Mother had a call

Sunday, November 6, 1870.
A mild pleasant Sabbath
Company in the evening
Monday 7
Pleasant.
Copied a poem
Mother had a call
Tuesday 8
Unpleasant
Election Day
A rainy afternoon.
Began the book of Judges
Sent "The Goad-ful Christian" to  the "Life Boat"

Wednesday, November 9, 1870
Cold & windy
Wentworth defeated & Farwell elected
Thursday 10
Pleasant
Two weeks from today is Thanksgiving
Friday 11
Rainy morning
pleasant afterwards

Saturday, November 12, 1870.
Mild & pleasant
Lillie did some shopping

Sunday 13
A dark stormy Sabbath
Slim attendence at the Churches
Monday 14
Clear & pleasant
received a letter
Mother & Spyek took a long walk.

Tuesday, November 15, 1870.
Cold & pleasant
Mother had company
Sent "Admonition" to the "Waverly"
Wednesday 16
Cold & pleasant
Father brought home a splendid Bible.
Thursday 17
Pleasant
A cold wind.'
Mother gone all day.

Friday, November 19, 1870.
Pleasant
Father had a call
Saturday 19
Rather cold
Della borrowed one of Dickens' works for me
Sunday 20
A dreary Sabbath
Cold & cloudy
Red the book of Ruth

Monday, November 21, 1870.
Cold but pleasant
Recieved the "Life Boat" containing my poem
"The Youthful Christian"
Tuesday 22
Cold & clowdy
Copied of poem
Wednesday 23
Pleasant & mild
Della at home helping mother.
Had a thanksgiving gift from an un-known source

Thursday, November 24, 1870
A beautiful day for Thanksgiving. Mild
& pleasant.
Enjoyed the day
Friday 25
Still pleasant.
The girls at home
Saturday 26
Mild & pleasant
Mother & Lillie took a long walk.
Had our coal

Sunday, November 27, 1870
A mild beautiful Sabbath
Nothing more
Monday 28
Still very mild
Sent "Trusting God" to the "Life Boat"
Recieved "Our Young Folks"
Tuesday 29
Still pleasant
Della & I wrote to Aunt Kitty

Wednesday, November 30, 1870
A beautiful day.
The last day of Autumn
Thursday, December 1
Very mild for the first day of winter.
Nothing more
Friday 2
Very pleasant.
Father had a  severe fall from the Horse Cars
Wrote a letter

Saturday, December 3, 1870
Pleasant
Mother had a call
Sunday 4
A pleasant Sabbath
Della had a sick day.
Monday 5
Mild & cloudy
Wind & rain at night.
Copied a poem

Tuesday, December 6, 1870
Pleasant
Sent "A Waif" to the "Waverly"
Father had a call
Wednesday 7
A slight snow storm
Mild & Cloudy
Thursday 8
Pleasant
Mother & Lillie went away in the evening
Wrote a letter

Friday, December 9, 1870
Still pleasant
Mother most sick
Saturday 10
Mild & cloudy
Copied a poem
Della got me some reading
Sunday 11
A stormy Sabbath
Wind, rain & snow.
2 weeks from today is Christmas

Monday, December 12, 1870.
Still stormy
Sent 2 poems to the "Life Boat"
Tuesday 13
Still Stormy
Recieved the "Waverly" containing "All Things to Enjoy"
Wednesday 14
Cold but pleasant
nothing more

Thursday, December 15, 1870
Mild.
Father brought home a jar of Honey
Friday 16
Cloudy
Had quite a surprise
Saturday 17
Cloudy
Della went to a birthday party

Sunday, December 18, 1870.
A cold cloudy Sabbath.
One more Sunday in this year
Monday 19
Winter at last.
A heavy snow storm
Recieved a package of papers
Tuesday 20
A winter's day
nothing more

Wednesday, December 21, 1870
Cold
Miss Nilsson - the Swedish singer holds her seasonal concert at the Opera House
Thursday 22
Colder
Mother & the girls had thier new rubbers
Friday 23
Coldist
Tomorrow night is Christmas Eve

Saturday, December 24, 1870.
Very cold.
Mother had a Splendid Christmas Gift,
Glad am I
Sunday 25
A cold stormy Sabbath
Lillie had a sick day
Monday 26
Still very cold
Mother had another Christmas Gift
Lillie still sick

Tuesday, December 27, 1870
Warmer & very pleasant
Mother & Della took a long walk.
Sent "A Noble Work" to the "Waverly"
Wednesday 28
A stormy day.
Shall have to give my Diary in three days more
Thursday 29
Cold again.
The girls went to the church.
They remembered me

Friday December 30 1870
Teacher - Miss Barnes
Annie Bartlett
Georgie Strong
Martha Phelan
Mable Blake
Saturday 31
Dora Smith
Helen Robison
Hettie Lawrence
Maryann Caffrey
Mary Arnold
Carrie Clark
Willie Bartlett
Willie Lawrence
Georgie Winter
Spedsie Barnes
Eddie Barnes

MEMORANDA
August 7th 1869

Took a ride out in the country with a friend of mine - Mr Reese.

Saw the great eclipse of the Sun from under an old tree near a pleasant farm-house where I
spent the day. Took my dinner, & eat it in a picnic fashion under the old tree.
Oceanica is an Poland Division
